articles.author: Sam Magdy, AP
articles.title: Fleeing war, poverty, African migrants face racism in Egypt
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of sub-Saharan African migrants call Cairo their temporary home
articles.content: CAIRO Two Sudanese sisters, Seham and Ekhlas Bashir, were walking their children home from elementary school in a Cairo neighborhood when a group of Egyptian teenagers crowded around them. They boys taunted them, calling them politician and other slurs. Then they … [+5931 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Several feared trapped in factory fire in Indian capital
articles.description: A fire official says a factory caught fire and collapsed in the Indian capital and several people are feared trapped
articles.content:
NEW DELHI A factory caught fire and collapsed in the Indian capital Thursday and several people were feared trapped, a fire official said.
Rescue work was in progress in Peera Garhi area in western New Delhi.
The New Delhi Television news channel said the s… [+503 chars]

articles.author: Carolyn Hax
articles.title: Carolyn Hax: A stay-at-home mom feels hurt when her in-law goes back to work
articles.description: If it were a one-size-fits-all decision, what would there be to decide?
articles.content:
Adapted from an online discussion.
Hi, Carolyn: I am a stay-at-home mom of children 9, 7 and 4. My brother and his wife had their first baby three months ago. Before the baby was born, my sister-in-law, "Sue," told me she was thinking of staying home full ti… [+2736 chars]

articles.title: Report: Taiwan's top military official survives copter crash
articles.description: Taiwan's top military official is reported to be among at least 11 survivors of a Blackhawk helicopter crash
articles.content:
TAIPEI, Taiwan Taiwans top military official was reported among at least 11 survivors of a Blackhawk helicopter crash Thursday morning in mountains outside the capital.

articles.author: Yuri Kageyama, AP
articles.title: Japan's emperor waves to crowds in 1st New Year's greeting
articles.description: Japan's Emperor Naruhito has waved to cheering, flag-waving crowds from a palace balcony in his first New Year's greeting since ascending to the throne
articles.content:
TOKYO Japans Emperor Naruhito waved to cheering, flag-waving crowds from a palace balcony Thursday in his first New Years greeting since ascending to the throne.
Naruhito and his wife Masako were joined by his parents, the former Emperor Akihito and his wife… [+1192 chars]

articles.title: Some flee, others restock before Australia's wildfires grow
articles.description: Thousands of tourists are fleeing Australia's wildfire-ravaged eastern coast ahead of worsening conditions as the military started to evacuate people trapped on the shore further south
articles.content:
